course_title: Topics in Social Justice and Social Movements: African Americans&Human Rights
class_notes: This course compels students to engage the concept and laws of human rights as they apply to Black people in the United States. African Americans' human rights, in fact, will be the framework to train students in the techniques of research, writing, analysis of evidence, interpretation, and criticism. Consequently, the major emphasis will be on the production and analytical review of research papers.
course_description: This course introduces students to critical readings in studies of African American social justice and social movements.
sections: Class Nbr: 5656, Section #: 1, Type: SEM, Campus: ATL, Meets: W 2-5p, Instructor: C. Anderson, Status: Open
